name: Chanterelles on Toast
description: Toasted baguette slices topped with buttery sautéed chanterelle mushrooms, garlic, and thyme. Serve warm, garnished with extra thyme.

ingredients.name: chanterelle mushrooms, cleaned and roughly chopped
fresh thyme leaves, plus more for garnish

steps.description: Melt the butter in a large cast-iron pan over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook, stirring, until softened but not browned, about 1 minute.
Add the chanterelles and stir to coat with butter. Cook, stirring frequently, until most moisture evaporates and mushrooms soften, about 8 minutes. Stir in the thyme and salt, then remove from heat.

Meanwhile, spread the olive oil in a baking pan and place the baguette slices on it, flipping once to coat both sides. Toast in the oven until lightly golden on top, about 10 minutes, then flip and toast another 10 minutes.
Top each piece of toast with a scoop of chanterelles. Garnish with extra thyme leaves and serve warm.
